utterance.speaker: GINGER
utterance.content: I gotta Tweet this. No one will believe that I'm with theTerrific Nick.

utterance.speaker: GINGER
utterance.content: I'll bet. And it smells so good.

utterance.speaker: GINGER
utterance.content: Smells like ribs. Is that barbecue pizza?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Nice and crispy, just the way you like it.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You made it, but I'm not hungry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You've never said no to turkey bacon. What's wrong?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Tell me.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Don't make me tong you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not even a smile - must be serious.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It's Lauren's birthday party. I'm not going.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? You've been talking about that party for weeks. It's gonna be the party of the century.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Yesterday Lauren came up to me in front of everybody, told me I was disinvited. It was humiliating.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why would Lauren do something like that? She's one of your best friends.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: She was one of my best friends. I have no idea why she's acting like this,and she refuses to talk to me. Ashley's still invited and so is everyone else, and...I have to be a social leper.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, Ashley's not going to go without you.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Just because I have leprosy doesn't mean he should.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I think you should throw a rival party. Invite all your friends to that one instead.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: The party is tonight, and she's having a live band performing. I can't compete with that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, I'll call Lauren's mom and--

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You're joking, right? What - so I can be a leper and a tattle tale? I'm seventeen. I can deal with this on my own.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It's just...every instinct in my body is telling me to protect her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, well, when it comes to teenagers, not even you can protect her. Alexis is going to have to deal with backstabbers her whole life, but she's intelligent enough to rise above all of that.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Like it or no, she looked like she was ready to commit murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Speaking of murder...

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I thought Terrific Nick's on the East Side was number one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, no, that was Authentic Terrific Nick's. This is just Authentic.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: This isn't Terrific?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No. Just Authentic. It's also not Terrific Authentic Nick's, but that's across the street.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, what's the difference?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The difference is, this one has a dead body in the oven.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Ooh-kay. That is really--

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well done.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Another couple of hours, maybe, but luckily for me, he's only half baked.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Male, mid forties, that's about as much ID as I can give you. Based on the oven setting and the body's core temperature, I'd say he went in no sooner than two am.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm afraid to ask...cause of death?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Wasn't the oven. The stab wound through the chest says that he was dead when he went in.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: No signs of forced entry, but we're running prints on the door handles just the same.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, run 'em on the oven as well. Who found him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Uhh, Nick Jr.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Authentic, not Terrific.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who were the last ones here last night?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And when was that?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Four thirty? Where's your lady friend now?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I don't think there's going to be a second date.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm going to need a list of all your employees and delivery staff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: As soon as you get me that list, I'll start making phone calls.

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: Aw, I don't believe this. You've got to be kidding me!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You must be Authentic Nick.

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: The one and only.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nick? I have the proprietor listed as Ralph Carbone.

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: Yeah, that's me. Everybody calls me Nick.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: 'Cause, that's what everybody calls me. I can't believe it! Those bastards put a body in my oven.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I'm sorry, Mr. Carbone, you think you know who did this?

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: Yeah, sure! I bet it was that jackhole.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Terrific Authentic Nick?

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: Stole my freakin' recipes. It's Sal that done this, along with the other two.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The other two?

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: Yeah, that vulture there.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Terrific Nick?

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: And the other dirt bag there.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And Authentic Terrific Nick.

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: All three of them! They're thieves. They live off of our name, and they're not even real Nicks. I'm the only real Nick.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And your real name is Ralph.

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: Exactly.

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: They've been trying to run me out of Dodge for years, and now this! Who's gonna buy my pizza now? Huh?

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: Hey! Hey! You hear me? I'm outta business!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Carbone, what makes you think that one of them did this?

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: Weeks ago, one of them stuck a gallon of soap into my secret sauce. Cost me a whole day of returned pies. Now look, I may or may not have retaliated, but if I did, them puttin' a cadaver in my oven, that's uhh them retaliatin' back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Carbone, that's not a cadaver.

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: Whadda you mean? Ehh, they probably got this from some medical school.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Nope, this isn't a prank, this is murder.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We got through to all their employees. Everyone is accounted for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Lanie, what are the chances of getting an ID?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Not hopeful of fingerprints. We may have to wait for a missing person's report and dental records.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: We also started a canvass to see if anybody saw anything last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let's get statements off all the employees. Especially the ones with keys; I'd like to know what they were doing last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Shouldn't we look into the other Nicks, too?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Come on, bro, you don't really think this is about some kind of pizza rivalry, do you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Competition to be the best in New York? Clear animosity? Carbone said they'd broken in before. If we are looking into everyone with access, we should look into them as well.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He's right, you know? Pizza's a serious business in this town.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, great, you talk to them.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wait, me? No, what? Come on.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have to admit, a pizza oven? A very clever way to get rid of a body. In At Dusk We Die, I had my psychotic paralegal kill her abusive boss and put him in a pottery kiln. He was reduced to ashes in a matter of hours. Of course...you already know this, don't you?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That's probably what our killer panned on doing before Nick Jr. showed up.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Did I hear right that you found a body in an oven at Terrific Nick's?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Authentic Nick's.

utterance.speaker: MONGTOMERY
utterance.content: Authentic Nick's! Oh thank God, the wife loves Terrific Nick's; I don't have the heart to tell her it now comes in full body flavor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ooh, I liked it. I liked it!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so we ran through all of Authentic Nick's employees. They alibied out, but I did find a bunch of stuff on the other Nicks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Criminal complaints?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah. Dozens of them. Filed back and forth between all the Nicks over the years. Uh, bricks through front windows, slashed delivery car tires, ooh, flaming bags of poo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yup.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? That's it?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Flaming bags of poo? Soap in secret sauces? Come on, Castle. What do you think? These guys suddenly graduated from frat pranks to murder?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Beckett.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: As expected, the body was too badly burned to get any prints, but I did find this. You see here where the shin bone should be? Those are titanium plates.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So killer cyborg his coordinates and redirects him into a pizza oven, saving humanity.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: The plates had serial numbers. I ran them through the surgical database and got an ID.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Gordon Burns?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gordon Burns?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Yes, Castle. Burns. Go ahead, make your joke, get it out of your system.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Gordon Burns, as in New York Ledger?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, not personally. He was a reporter. I used to love his work. Did you find anything on the body?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: A melted cell phone belt clip, but there was no cell phone.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, it wasn't at the crime scene either.

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: And that's his wallet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Credit cards, driver's license, that's all melted. Girlfriend? Wife?

utterance.speaker: LANIE
utterance.content: Burns is listed as divorced, no next of kin.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He was a war correspondent. An investigative reporter. What was he doing in a pizza oven?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Maybe his editor knows.

utterance.speaker: WALT SHAW
utterance.content: We were friends. When I became editor of the paper, he was my first hire.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The kinds of stories he wrote, he must have stepped on his fair share of toes.

utterance.speaker: WALT SHAW
utterance.content: No, not for years. He'd been out of the game for a while.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why is that?

utterance.speaker: WALT SHAW
utterance.content: His kid was killed in an accident. She was ten. After that, he finally gave in to his love affair with the bottle.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We see that you still had him on the payroll.

utterance.speaker: WALT SHAW
utterance.content: He did the occasional human interest story for our lifestyle section. Waste of his talent, but it let him make rent and keep his insurance.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Mr. Shaw, was he working on anything recently?

utterance.speaker: WALT SHAW
utterance.content: Just a puff piece I’d assigned him last week.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: WALT SHAW
utterance.content: The pizza wars. You know, the authentic, amazing, terrific guys always fighting over which one was the best.

utterance.speaker: WALT SHAW
utterance.content: It wasn’t Afghanistan, but Gordon was Gordon. He called a few days ago and said it was much bigger than I thought.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bigger how?

utterance.speaker: WALT SHAW
utterance.content: He didn’t say. But I mean it’s pizza wars. How big could it be?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Big enough to kill for.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let’s dig deeper into all of the Nicks - terrific, authentic, and otherwise - and let’s also run background checks on all of their employees.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, this guy survived Afghanistan, invasion of Iraq, even Tienanmen Square. To be killed doing a puff piece on pizza?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s like being a cop, bro. You survive a fire fight with a dozen armed gang bangers only to be hit by a car writing a speeding ticket on the LIE.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey. Ran a trace on Burns’ missing phone. It’s either out of batteries or turned off.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right. Run LEDs and financials and find out where he was and what he was doing last night.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: On it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: This has to be about something bigger than who has the best pizza.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, Burns probably had notes and drafts of his story in his apartment. If we can find them, we can figure out what he was up to last night.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Let’s go.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Door’s been kicked open.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Room’s clear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Place is trashed.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’m going to check with the neighbors, see if any of them heard anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: These drawers have been emptied. If there were any files or notes, they’re gone now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, whatever he was working on, someone didn’t want us to find it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You okay?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, no, yeah. Um I think I met her. I went to a book signing of his, the one he did on the Sarajevo Snipers…she was…coloring, next to him, while he was signing books.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He must have been a good writer for you to stand in line.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, he was.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Come on, let’s go get CSU.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Hey, I’ve got something weird. Burns’ neighbor…she says she’s been holding his mail for the last week. Apparently, Burns told her he was going out of the country for a while.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Out of the country? We know he’s been here.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know, that’s the kind of lie you tell people when you don’t want people looking for you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And if he’s been staying somewhere else, there’s a chance we can still find his notes.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Let me get a hold of his editor; find out where he might have been staying.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: How does a story about pizza send someone into hiding?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or get them killed. Beckett.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, I just got the CSU report back. The back doorknob of the pizza shop was wiped clean, but they did find Nick’s prints all over the pizza oven.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, that’s to be expected. He works there.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Not Authentic Nick. These prints belong to his neighbor across the street, Terrific Authentic Nick.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So Nick, or should I say, Sal. Know this guy?

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: Yeah, I know him. That’s the reporter doing the story on us.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what did the two of you talk about?

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: Who’s the real Nick. And I told him about my grandpa Nick. How he was an authentic Ellis Island immigrant who was flippin’ his terrific dough on Mott Street the very day he arrived.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What else?

utterance.speaker: SAL MALVOLTA
utterance.content: That’s it, why?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just doesn’t seem like a good enough reason to kill.

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: Kill?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We found your fingerprints, Sal, all over the oven.

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: You found my prints?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah. So why don’t we back up and you tell us why you killed Burns.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And this time, hold the extra cheese.

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: I-I can explain. I was there, but I didn’t kill nobody. Ralph thought I was soaping his sauce, so he broke into my place, took all the breakers out of my electrical pad. Now he’s always bragging about his oven, so I thought I’d—

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Put a body in it.

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: No. Steal it. I went over there a couple nights ago to see what I needed to get it out.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You’re kidding me, right?

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: I was in O’Mary’s on Staten Island last night, till closing, okay? It was dart night. I took third place. You wanna look at somebody? Look at Ralph.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why Ralph?

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: What, you think he makes that money with his crappy pizza? He’s connected. That’s why I left. All he cares about laundering money for his wise guy pals.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You didn’t happen to mention this to Burns, did you?

utterance.speaker: SAM MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: As a matter of fact, I did.

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: Money laundering? Whoa!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We ran you through the Federal Database. We know about the FBI investigation in the 90s and your connection to the Spolano crime family.

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: My connection… They’re my second cousin once removed. I see them at Thanksgiving dinner once every five years. And the Feds didn’t find anything.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Feds didn’t, but maybe Burns did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what happened, Ralph? Did he threaten to expose you? You make him disappear before that son of yours showed up, before that oven you’re so proud of could finish the job?

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: I make money with my pizza. You’re gonna find the exact same thing the Feds found. Nadda, zip, zilch. Sal put you twos up to this, right? Sal’s the one who brought in the Feds in the first place, tryin’ to shut me down. You should be lookin’ at him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sal had an alibi for last night. What about you, Mr. Carbone?

utterance.speaker: RALPH CARBONE
utterance.content: I’m at home in bed. You could ask my wife. And that reporter? All he ever asked me about was pizza.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That guy is guilty of something.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not until we have proof.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan, any luck on where our victim was last night?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Oh, I’m still waiting for info from his bank, but I got his LUDS. Nothing last night, and only a few calls to his editor in the previous days.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: A reporter chasing down a story? No, there should be dozens of calls.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, maybe he was making them from where he was staying. Any leads on where he was staying?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, but I got in touch with Burns’ ex in Portland…they hadn’t been in touch for years.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo. Pay dirt. At first it was all ‘he’s so quiet, he keeps to himself,’ but this other neighbor who just came home, said that she saw Burns and another guy have a knockdown drag out right before he left.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: About what?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: All she remembers is the other guy yelling “If you try to print that, I swear to God I’ll kill you.”

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did you get a description?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: I’ll give you a hint. He’s Authentic. And Terrific.

utterance.speaker: LUCA SABALINI
utterance.content: So me and Burns argued, so what? It’s a free country.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Free speech doesn’t cover death threats, Mr. Sabalini.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Or murder.

utterance.speaker: LUCA SABALINI
utterance.content: I told you, I was home last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah you did, but your wife tells a different story.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It seems she remembers you sneaking out before midnight after you thought she was asleep.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: She told us he was off to see ‘that ***** mistress of his over in Flatbush,’ and when she confronted you about it this morning, you said you went into the city because the store’s alarm was going off.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: We checked. It wasn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So who were you lying to, Luca? Me or your wife?

utterance.speaker: LUCA SABALINI
utterance.content: My wife. I was with Angie last night. You can ask her.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I could. Doesn’t mean I’m gonna believe her. What were you and Burns fighting about?

utterance.speaker: LUCA SABALINI
utterance.content: He was gonna write something about me. Destroy everything I work for. I had to stop him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And what was he going to write?

utterance.speaker: LUCA SABALINI
utterance.content: About my pizza. About what makes my fat free pizza taste so good. It’s made with real cheese. There’s nothing fat free about it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You were going to kill for that?

utterance.speaker: LUCA SABALINI
utterance.content: It’s an expression! Besides, Burns called me last night. He said he’d consider not running it if I did him a favor.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What favor?

utterance.speaker: LUCA SABALINI
utterance.content: Uh, he didn’t say what. He was supposed to stop by today to talk about it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You said that he called you yesterday? From where?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Okay. The incoming call to his cell came from the Hotel Beta in Midtown.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, let’s go.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Paid in cash, signed in under the name ‘Melville,’ this guy’s definitely flying under the radar.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, there’s a computer.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay. “New York’s Authentic Terrific Pizza Wars.” Sharp narration, delicate prose - This isn’t an expose.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s a puff piece.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You can practically smell the garlic, but there’s nothing in there that’s heavier than pizza.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or what got him killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm, his most recent notes. Pizza, recipes, inter—

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Look at that.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s last night. He was meeting with someone.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone from that phone number, just before he was killed.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I’m going to run that down.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You have an app for that?!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, NYPD issue. We just got it.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can I?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Whoa!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Fine, then you don’t get to play my Angry Birds.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And they just came out with a new one… Johnny Farrell, Swede Anderson. How do I know those names?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I don’t know, but recognize this person?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s the woman from Burns’ wallet.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Bingo. Monica Wyatt. And if she met with him last night, she might have been the last person to see him alive.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wonder if they went out for pizza.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: A little upscale for the pizza world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Unless she has a middle man. For the money laundering operation? She transfers the money out of the country into Swiss bank accounts using the names Johnny Farrell and Swede Anderson.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or, she’d just a real estate agent and she claims to be one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s just a cover story to avoid scrutiny from the Feds.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You had a lot of imaginary friends growing up, didn’t you?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Still do.

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: Hi. Can I help you?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: I can’t believe he still had this. He actually took this on our first date.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And how long were the two of you together?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: Just a couple months. But…God, this had to be three years ago. I saw him once or twice after his daughter’s accident. He was different…it’s like he just drifted away.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What made you see him last night?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: I-I didn’t see him last night.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, according to his notes, he met up with you at 10pm.

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: Well, that wasn’t a meeting, that was a date. But…he didn’t show.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You said you hadn’t seen him in years. How did you end up on a date?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: We bumped into each other on the street the other day. It was weird because it was down in the Village, and I never go down there and he said that he doesn’t go down there either, but he was working on a story.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did he tell you what it was about?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: No.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: How did he seem? Worried? Distressed?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: He seemed like himself. Like his old self. Like he was on to something. He had just come from the Hall of Records and whatever he found, he was really excited about.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The Hall of Records?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ms. Wyatt, do the names Johnny Farrell or Swede Anderson mean anything to you?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: I can’t say they do.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Monica Wyatt checks. Her brokerage house says that she complains about commissions more than they like, but other than that, she’s clean. Find anything else in there?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: No, the rest is just pizza.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, I just got through Burns’ financials.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any activity last night?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Yeah, something odd. At 11:15pm he used his ATM card.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Where?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh, not so good neighborhood about 15 blocks away from Authentic Nick’s. But here’s the odd part. He never finished the transaction.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You mean he cancelled it.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, no, he never finished it. He popped in his ATM card, but then after about a minute of inactivity, it ate his card, almost as if—

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Something happened.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get ATM surveillance. Let’s find out what. I’m going to go to the Hall of Records tomorrow morning, see if we can find out what Burns was up to.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What happened?

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Alexis decided to crash Lauren’s party against our better judgment.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And I take it the party crashing didn’t go so well?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: None of this would have happened if Lauren wasn’t the most conniving ***** in the entire world.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa…

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: It’s warranted.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: When the band was performing, Lauren brought Ashley up on stage with her and she kissed him. In front of everyone.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: How could she do this to me? To Ashley?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What did Ashley do?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: He was mortified. He ran off stage and we left. He was apologizing a thousand times and said he had no idea that she was going to do that. It’s like she was trying to break us up this whole time. This was, like, her master plan.

utterance.speaker: MARTHA
utterance.content: Well, she didn’t succeed, darling, you and Ashley are stronger than ever, and she looks like a fool.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I wish that were true. According to the internet, Ashley cheated on me. She already posted pictures of them kissing all over her website. It’s a nightmare.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Where’s Beckett?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hall of Records, tracking down what Burns was looking for.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Great. Listen, if I gave you a website, could you have your friends at Tech attack and take some pictures down?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Did someone find naked pictures of you again?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not me, it’s Alexis.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s for Alexis.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: This just got awkward. What’s this about?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Okay, mean girl at school kiss ambushed Alexis’ boyfriend and posted photographic proof on her website. Alexis…very upset.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hmm…I-I’m gonna have my friend Tony take care of it off the record.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thanks. And, uh, no need to mention this to Beckett… You know how she gets about these things…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Things like abusing police resources for your own personal agenda?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whaat? That’s ridi—no-I—No, that’s, that’s -

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what did you find? Anything on Nicks?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Not exactly. Burns requested files relating to the 2003 murder of a drug trafficker, Harley Romero, aka Harley Playful, also known as Handsome Harley. Judging from those photos, I’m guess it was ironic.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He’s been dead for years, what's he got to do with pizza?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey, Ryan? Did you get a chance to look into all the Nicks and their employees?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Uh yeah, just going over the reports now. Mostly minor stuff.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any drug charges?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: No, nothing about drugs.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Romero…you think it was some kind of Mafia tie in with Nicks?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: According to the files, there’s no connection to any of the families.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, someone didn’t like him. It says here that he was shot a dozen times, dumped in an oil drum and set on fire.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, word on the street is that some dealer killed him over a turf war.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So why was Burns looking at him?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Bank’s just sent over surveillance videos. You’re going to want to see this.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Looks like he’s running from something.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s running from something all right…watch this.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: He knows he’s on camera.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He’s trying to tell us something.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: He’s writing something.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, take it back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And…freeze there. He’s got a knife.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: He’s trying to send us a message, but he recorded his own murder.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Close up on the face?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Castle, look at that face?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That’s Harley Romero.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And he is very much alive.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Why would he stop to write a message? Why not just keep running?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Well, that street empties onto a blind alley…maybe Burns thought he couldn’t get away.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Any idea what he was writing there?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: We’re seeing if tech can enhance the image, but we found no connection between this Harley and the pizza joint.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Maybe pizza has nothing to do with it. Maybe Burns knew Harley from an old story.

utterance.speaker: CHARLES SHAW
utterance.content: No, I don’t recognize him at all.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Did Burns ever mention the name Harley in any of his stories?

utterance.speaker: CHARLES SHAW
utterance.content: Never. When this guy supposedly died, Gordon was embedded with the second Marine division in Gulf Two.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mr. Shaw, do the names Johnny Farrell or Swede Anderson mean anything to you?

utterance.speaker: CHARLES SHAW
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah they do. They’re both characters from old film noir movies.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Right! Uh, Johnny Farrell from the movie Gilda, Glenn Ford’s character - and Burt Lancaster played Swede Anderson in the movie The Killers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And why would these two names be important?

utterance.speaker: CHARLES SHAW
utterance.content: This guy Harley, what kinds of drugs was he dealing?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Heroin. Why?

utterance.speaker: CHARLES SHAW
utterance.content: Because the only heroin story Burns ever chased was the one he couldn’t finish. About a high end distribution ring in New York that set up shop in legitimate businesses. When someone needed product, they used a code word. Their code word happens to be characters from film noir. It’s that story that destroyed him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: CHARLES SHAW
utterance.content: Because of the guy who was behind the ring. It was Cavallo. Gordon was gunning for the Prince of Darkness himself.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Who’s Cavallo?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: It’s a street myth. An urban legend. Every time a dealer gets whacked, they say it’s Cavallo, but he’s not even real.

utterance.speaker: CHARLES SHAW
utterance.content: Cavallo is real.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh come on, we’ve all heard the scary stories.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I didn’t.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So the story goes that Cavallo was mentored by this badass Colombian drug lord, Cozzy the Conquer, and eventually, he put a bullet to his boss’ head, slit all of his kids' throats, and took over the operation. But I mean, it’s a fairy tale.

utterance.speaker: CHARLES SHAW
utterance.content: Not to Burns. Not to his daughter. Burns told me he had a contact that was getting him close to Cavallo. The next day, he and his daughter are crossing the street, this car appears out of nowhere. When he came to, his leg was shattered, Nina was twenty feet away bleeding out and he couldn’t even hold her so don’t you tell me Cavallo isn’t real.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Sounds like Burns was Ahab and Cavallo was the White Whale.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he did sign into the hotel as “Melville.”

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, it’s that kind of sly humor that Burns is known for. And while I am loath to profile, the name Cavallo, also Italian for “horse,” might link back to the four Nicks.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hey Ryan? When you were in Narcotics, when was the first time you heard about Cavallo?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: I dunno, probably around ’03, around the time when all those dealers were getting whacked.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh, that’s right – when Harley was killed.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So Harley stages his own death, brutally murders his competition, and then starts a whisper campaign on the streets about the new Dark Prince of heroin.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And a legend is born.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, Tech was able to blow up and enhance that ATM video. They’re sending it up now.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I still can’t make it out.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Mmm.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Run it again.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Can you flip it and slow it down?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What are you doing?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What I do best – writing. Okay, 3, 6, S—

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Could be a five.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: ‘Kay, S or a 5. W, 1, 2, 7?

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: It’s an address.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: B, A, S?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Basement. 365 W 127th Street in the basement.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That’s three blocks from the ATM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Police! Nobody move!

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: NYPD!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Room’s clear.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Someone moved out in a hurry.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Coffee grinders for cutting, envelopes for packing.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: All the earmarks of a well organized heroin processing plant.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Get CSU in here, sweep the area. If anyone saw anything I wanna know. Looks like your Ahab found his White Whale.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And it took him under.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Hi Dad, bye Dad.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What? No kiss?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Whoa, whoa, whoa, whoa, Alexis, what happened to your face?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Nothing.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s not nothing, what happened?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Lauren. She cornered me in the bathrooms at school, said that I ruined her party, and then she accused me of hacking into her account and deleting those pictures she took…as if!

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And-and then what happened?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Well, I called her a backstabber, and then she scratched me. So I…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You what?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I punched her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What were you thinking?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: I don’t know! This isn’t me. I don’t crash parties. I don’t get in fights with people, but Dad, she made me so angry.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I know she did, but…retaliation is not the answer. You get her back, she gets you back, and then one day one of you ends up dead in a pizza oven. Is that what you want? Look, you’re going to have to deal with mean, backstabbing girls your whole life. You need to be smart enough to…rise above. Okay?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Come here.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Did you kick her ass?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Kinda did.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Good girl.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I should have gotten involved much earlier.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Why? Lauren still would have found a way to make Alexis’ life miserable.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: She’s not a criminal mastermind, she’s just a teenager.

utterance.speaker: BECEKTT
utterance.content: Aww, Castle, never underestimate the power of a woman on a mission.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Mmm, no, I don’t, and I have the alimony checks to prove it.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Just hung up with the lab. The trace of heroin in the processing house matched most of the dope being peddled on the Lower East. Any word on this Harley?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Sir, if half the rumors about this guy are true, he’s got snitches all over the force, so I was thinking of holding off on an APB until we knew more.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: Keep me posted.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yes, sir.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, Shaw said that Cavallo is using legitimate businesses to distribute product. You think he could be operating through one of the Nicks?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Yeah, but I can’t get a warrant for a fishing expedition. We’re going to have to have something more concrete.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, CSU swept the tenement basement – not one print anywhere.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Any witnesses see Burns getting chased?

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: That neighborhood? Nobody sees nothing. But one of the uniforms did find this in one of the storm drains near the ATM.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Burns’ phone?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Does it strike anyone else as strange that a seasoned war correspondent would suddenly develop butterfingers, drop his phone while being chased?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You think he purposely dropped it?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So whoever chasing him wouldn’t get his phone—

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Or what was on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: The last call he made was 911, and he didn’t press send.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Outside the drug lab. He was casing the joint.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s Monica….she’s involved.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Monica Wyatt, NYPD, open up!

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Monica?!

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Step back.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Monica!

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: He-he-he tried to kill me.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Window! It’s open.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Monica, who did this to you?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: If I tell you, I’m dead.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: I think we’re past that. Who did it?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: Cavallo.

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: I wasn’t lying about Gordon. We did date years ago. I thought it was real, but he was just doing it to get close to Cavallo. I never imagined that…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What’s a Midtown real estate dealer doing mixed up with heroin dealers?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: Their labs are mobile. They need new places for their processing centers every month or so, and I had access to all the information they needed. Look…this is not who I am. I mean, I never meant for anyth…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did it start?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: I had some problems…a few years back…I owed some people money. A man came to me and told me he could make it all better…I just had to do a favor for him every now and then. And at the time, that actually sounded harmless…but this man knew things about me…thing that nobody could possibly know. I wanted to leave, but after what happened to Gordon’s kid, I just…Gordon found me a couple days ago. He said he needed my help. He said that I could end this and we could both be free. All I had to do was take him there. Now Gordon is dead, and I am next.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Cavallo…who is he?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: I’ve never seen him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Didn’t he just try to kill you?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: If I knew who Cavallo was, don’t you think I would have told Gordon? I’ve only ever dealt with Cavallo’s right hand man before…that’s who was here trying to kill me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: And who is this man?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: His name is Harley.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Him?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Harley is Cavallo. So Cavallo is hiding right under everyone’s noses.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How do I find him?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: He finds me.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Monica, Gordon was right. We can end this, but we need your help. We believe Cavallo is trafficking drugs through a pizzeria, but we need to know which one.

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: I’m sorry, I don’t know which one.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: Yo, we covered the whole area.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Wherever he was, he’s in the wind.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: All right, why don’t you guys take Monica to the ER, get her checked, then get her over to Narcotics. They can talk to her.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: One last question. Johnny Farrell and Swede Anderson.

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: It’s how Gordon got onto the story in the first place. He heard someone at one of the pizza joints use those names and he knew it was Cavallo’s code. Those were last week’s names.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Do you know this week’s names?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: No, but Gordon said they were from his favorite film. The Maltese Falcon.

utterance.speaker: ESPOSITO
utterance.content: If we hold them much longer, there’s going to be another murder on our hands.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Relax, we’re almost done. We’ve got two Nicks down, two to go. ‘Kay, call you in a bit.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: I wonder if I should used Sydney Greenstreet’s character, Kasper Gutman…now there’s a guy who loved his pizza.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well we already put out money down on Bogie, so let’s just play this through.

utterance.speaker: PIZZA BOY
utterance.content: Slice?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Uh, no, pick up, actually. For Spade. Sam Spade.

utterance.speaker: PIZZA BOY
utterance.content: Of course, Mr. Spade. I have your order right here.

utterance.speaker: PIZZA BOY
utterance.content: Here you go, Mr. Spade, we’ll put it on your tab.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Winner, winner, pizza dinner.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Possession, trafficking, conspiracy to distribute, that right there is 30 years…easy, Sal. 30 Terrific, Authentic years.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: It’s life if you’re an accessory to Burns’ murder.

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: I had nothing to do with that, I swear.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Swear? What are you trying to tell me? That Harley had the idea to put the body in your rival’s oven?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You’re a pizza man, Sal. Body in an oven…sounds more like your speed.

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: No, no, no, no, no, it was him. It was all him.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So what? Now you’re a victim?

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: Look, my place was struggling. He came to me and said that the man he was working for could help. All I had to do was let him use my shop for a couple of months. And he would make…my dream come true.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Your dream?

utterance.speaker: SAL MALVOLTA
utterance.content: Yeah…he said that after it was over…the man he worked for would uh…burn down Authentic Nick’s. This ain’t me. I never even smoked a joint. All the other Nicks, the stuff they were doing, it was driving me crazy.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: How did Burns’ body get in the oven?

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: Harley called me that night. Said he needed to throw something in my oven overnight. He didn’t say what it was.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Yeah, but you knew it wasn’t a tray of lasagna.

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: And I said “No way. No way, I never signed up for cremation services.” I never dreamed…what I turned away would end up in Ralph Carbone’s oven.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want our help, Sal?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You want me to put in a good word with the DA?

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: Yeah.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Then help me find him. Help me find Cavallo.

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: You can’t find him. He finds you.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That’s not helping me, Sal.

utterance.speaker: SAL MALAVOLTA
utterance.content: You don’t get it. When I run out of product, I call him. He delivers.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Make the call.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Harley Romero, aka, the legendary Cavallo.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: He won’t talk without a lawyer.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: With the evidence from the ATM video and Sal’s testimony, he’s going to need one.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: You know, it’s brilliant when you think about it. The unassuming middleman does all the dirty work, while everyone stays busy looking for the menacing, mystery lord—

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Who no one ever meets, because he’s not really real.

utterance.speaker: MONTOMGERY
utterance.content: Real or not, he’s going away for a long time. Good work.

utterance.speaker: RYAN
utterance.content: Hey, so Narcotics just finished with Monica Wyatt. She cooperated fully.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Okay, process her out.

utterance.speaker: MONTGOMERY
utterance.content: But put a patrol car outside her building for the next few nights, just in case Cavallo has friends.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: What’s up?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Just thinking about Burns and how close he came to catching the guy who killed his daughter only to come up short.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, if it’s any consolation, there’s justice now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hmm, yeah. You know what still bugging me?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Hm?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: The guy is running for his life. Why did he ditch his phone?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Well, he probably knew he was going to get killed, so he wanted at least somebody to know the truth.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: What truth? It wasn’t like there was a picture of Cavallo on it.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: No, you’re right. The only person he had …

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: …he had a picture of was….

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Just a few more questions, Ms. Wyatt.

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: I’ve been waiting over an hour.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: You know the funny thing about this case is that nobody is who they claim to be. Not even you.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Monica Wyatt. Says here that you moved to New York in 2002 from LA?

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: Yeah, so?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: So we did a little bit of digging, and the only Monica Wyatt we found was a heroin addict who was shot point blank and then dumped in the LA river.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Six months later, word of a new and brutal started sweeping the streets.

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: And you’re saying that’s me? I’m a real estate agent. Have you seen my apartment?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah, we saw that one, but all of the other ones can only be previewed online.

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: What are you talking about?

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Your apartment sales to Walter Neff, Frank Chambers, Richard Harlin, they’re all characters from noir films. They aren’t real. You made millions in heroin holdings which you turned into millions in real estate holdings, all clean.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: All the while, perpetuating the myth of Cavallo.

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: Gordon didn’t die chasing a myth…

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah, Gordon. Now there’s something you didn’t completely lie about. You did meet him a couple of years ago, but not as the boyfriend. He was a pain in the ass reporter who kept getting just a little too close.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Until the car came out of nowhere…and killed his daughter.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: That got him out of your hair for a couple of years, but then he caught your scent again at Nick’s pizza.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: And that forced you to get rid of him permanently. And then you fed us Harley, the sacrificial lamb to throw us off your trail.

utterance.speaker: BECKETT
utterance.content: Oh yeah, and then he managed to run down the fire escape with such incredible speed that two of New York’s finest detectives were incapable of seeing him, never mind catching him.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Beating yourself up. It was a nice touch. You know what I just realized? All of those noir films that Cavallo draws his names from? They all have one thing in common. A femme fatale.

utterance.speaker: MONICA WYATT
utterance.content: I’d like my lawyer now.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Ah, great, you’re still up.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Couldn’t sleep if I wanted to.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: That makes two of us.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Is that from Sefanos?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: M-hm.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: You went all the way across the bridge for a pizza?

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Not just any one - fresh basil and sausage.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Any updates on the…?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Uh, um…I called a mediation session with our school counselor today, and it turns out Lauren was just jealous of all the time I was spending with Ashley. She thought I was ditching our friendship.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So what did you do?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: We…hugged it out…

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: So now you’re friends again?

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: It’s…too soon to tell.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Hurts like these…take a long time to heal.

utterance.speaker: ALEXIS
utterance.content: Time…and pizza.

utterance.speaker: CASTLE
utterance.content: Cheers.
